greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) (0<=k<=n) is the number of Delannoy paths of length n, having k (1,1)-steps on the line y=x (a Delannoy path of length n is a path from (0,0) to (n,n), consisting of steps (E=1,0), N=(0,1) and D(1,1)).
comment: Row sums are the central Delannoy numbers (A001850).
link: Robert A. Sulanke, Objects Counted by the Central Delannoy Numbers, Journal of Integer Sequences, Volume 6, 2003, Article 03.1.5.
example: T(2,1)=4 because we have DNE, DEN, NED and END.
maple: G:=(t*z-z+sqrt(1-6*z+z^2))/(1-6*z+2*t*z^2-t^2*z^2): Gser:=simplify(series(G,z=0,13)): P[0]:=1: for n from 1 to 10 do P[n]:=coeff(Gser,z^n) od: for n from 0 to 10 do seq(coeff(t*P[n],t^k),k=1..n+1) od; # yields sequence in triangular form
results.author: _Emeric Deutsch_, Jul 06 2005
